metadata.title: CVE-2020-28021 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Exim 4 before 4.94.2 has Improper Neutralization of Line Delimiters. Anauthenticated remote SMTP client can insert newline characters into a spoolfile (which indirectly leads to remote code execution as root) via AUTH= ina MAIL FROM command.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-28021` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

exim4 - 4.82-3ubuntu2.4+esm3
exim4-base - 4.82-3ubuntu2.4+esm3
exim4-config - 4.82-3ubuntu2.4+esm3
exim4-daemon-heavy - 4.82-3ubuntu2.4+esm3
exim4-daemon-light - 4.82-3ubuntu2.4+esm3
eximon4 - 4.82-3ubuntu2.4+esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: exim4 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.82-3ubuntu2.4+esm3').
